data.title: Great Down Home Cookin!!!!
data.text: If you like good ole down home cookin' you will love this place!! Have eaten here multiple times. ALWAYS fresh and good! Burgers are second to none!!

data.title: Favorite soul food in the city
data.text: Yes you have found the best soul food in little rock.  England, ar near the airport is the original location and historic.  Downtown location only open in daytime so be sure and stroll in and you might find any given politician in house while your there.

data.title: OK Burger - BETTER Chicken
data.text: Cothmans may be known for their burger, but this location (in town) in my opinion has a really good fried chicken plate lunch.  The batter is just right, crispy and served with mashed potatoes with gravy and a roll.  The gravy is excellent!! Cant beat it with a wet squirrel folks!  If you want to hubcap - ride out to Scott for the original Cothams.  The fried Okra is VERY GOOD! If the state senate is in session, get their early, the politicians and their staff seem to like this joint...

data.title: First Time, OK Burger and Fries
data.text:
This was my first time to eat at Cotham's in the City.  I guess I aged myself when I asked my son if it was in the old TGI Friday's, back when TGIF was a novelty, building in Little Rock.  I quickly found out it was and is cleverly decorated with political yard signs given its close proximity to the Capitol.  

The service was good, and the burger and fries were okay, but I don't know that I would rush back or out of the way to experience.,  I asked my son about the hubcap burger, and he said it was "huge", so I stayed away and got the regular cheeseburger.  

The restaurant definitely has the political atmosphere with its decor, but timing will have to be just right to get a return visit.

data.title: Meh.....fried and ordinary
data.text: Okay, it's a block from the Capitol and attracts traffic from the lunch crowd.  It is a branch of the REAL Cotham's in Scott, AR, which is a supreme dive with the greasiest best hamburgers (do not get the hubcap unless there are four of you), which is built out over a cypress swamp heading toward serious delta farm country.  The one in Little Rock is Cotham's in name only.  Go to Cotham's in Scott (they have a pie shop and some great antique stores in the neighborhood, especially Morris Antiques right down the road in Keo, AR).  If you can't get to Scott, don't go to Cotham's.

data.title: Very Good if you like lots of Fried stuff!!
data.text: This is a great local place that serves...well, very good but lots of fried foods.  If this is your type of food then it really is worth the stop.  I ordered the appetizer plate of onion rings and got a huge portion that alone could have been a meal.  The special for the day was chicken fried steak so I ordered it with two sides.  The steak was fair, a bit tough and surprisingly not much flavor but the white gravy was superb and as my friend said, just like I remember it as a child.  The sides were really terrific, seasoned and fried okra that was very good as were the pinto beans.  The atmosphere is interesting, lots of political posters on the walls in a very relaxed setting.  For me, a once in a few month experience only because I don't eat the beef and fried to often, but those that do this is a great place to fill up.

data.title: Best Sweet Potato Fries Ever!
data.text: My husband found this place because it had been featured on TV. It is only open for lunch until 2, and we went straight here after flying into Little Rock on a Friday. He got the Hubcap Burger which is literally the size of a hubcap. I got a regular cheeseburger, but the most impressive food to me was the sweet potato fries. They were crispy and perfectly seasoned. We also enjoyed all the political signs in the restaurant and our server was very friendly and efficient.

data.title: GOOD GRUB!
data.text: The burger was good as we anticipated...cool atmosphere...you most definitely want to try this place if you are downtown Little Rock!

data.title: Never disappoints
data.text: What a fantastic lunch spot in little rock! Down home cooking and an even better atmosphere is what you'll get here! I highly recommend the fried green tomatoes and the fish plate; or anything on the menu!

data.title: Fantastic Grilled Chicken
data.text: The grilled chicken was the best we've ever tasted.  The hamburgers were good.  The hubcap burger was ridiculous-in a bad way.  People eating that, along with the fries are saying, "I want heart disease."

data.title: Never disapointed
data.text:
Cotham's, home of the hubcap burger, is a great place to eat.  The "in the city" restaurant is only open for lunch.  Aside from it's regular menu they offer daily, M-F, specials.

Service is quick; food fresh and well prepared.  Many local politicians frequent Cotham's.

data.title: Good burgers and fries for lunch.
data.text: I took a large group to Cotham's for lunch. We were quickly seated and the server was very attentive, brought our drinks and took our orders quickly. The food didn't take long to get to the table and everyone seemed to really enjoy their meals. I had a burger and fries and it was very, very good. The setting of the restaurant is country and is a relaxed atmosphere for sure. Everyone seemed to enjoy themselves and the bill was easy on the billfold. I'd certainly come here again when the need arises.

data.title: Pretty good food - great service!
data.text: I had heard about this place and wanted to try it. Heard the burgers and onion rings were legendary. The burger was really good, but the onion rings, not so much. They were somewhat soggy and lacked any real flavor. The place was hopping though and had a nice atmosphere and the service was good. Won't go back unless I'm with someone else who wants to go.

data.title: Some of the best fried fish I have ever had
data.text:
I'm new to Arkansas, so I've been told of the fried catfish which is a regional speciality. So I was taken here which apparently is a bit of an institution and quite popular with the government crowd. 

I was told to order the fried catfish which came with cole slaw, hush puppies (deep fried corn bread for those like me not in the know) and fries. Man oh man oh man. The fish was cooked to perfection. Breaded in what I think was corn meal and seasoned to perfection, it was so tasty and crispy but the white catfish meat simply fell apart, so good! Coming from England, known for it's fish and chis, it simply does not compare with this. In fact I have always maintained that British fried fish is bland and this place proves my point! 

My company had a hamburger which was huge (and it wasn't the hubcap) and good quality beef. I will definitely be trying here again!

data.title: Not bad if you are in the area.
data.text: Apparently, this is one of the local's favorites. Perhaps because of the Hubcap burger, which is big enough for two people. Outside of the novelty of "huge", there was nothing remarkable about the burger. I tried a half of hubcap in the form of a smothered steak with gravy and onions. It scored big. And my friends ordered the country fried steak, which covered most of the plate.  Fried Green tomatoes were very good. And the ranch was homemade. I enjoyed my time here, and the food was tasty, but I wouldn't go out of my way in the future to stop by again.

data.title: Amazing hubcap hamburgers
data.text: Cotham's has huge hubcap-sized hamburgers that are large enough to share. We love a good burger and these rate as the best we have ever eaten. The price is right also, and the service is great!

data.title: Reception Dinner Event
data.text: This place was good. We had appetizers and drinks for a reception dinner! My hubby and I will definitely come back and try their full menu out, on our next visit to Little Rock!

data.title: Local friends and local flavor
data.text: Located one block from the Arkansas State Capitol, this is a favorite of Little Rock locals, especially those who work at the capitol. The Hubcap Burger is a local favorite IF you have the appetite for it. Menu also includes smaller burgers, fried catfish, fried green tomatoes and so much more. Great atmosphere, fast service. Love to bring out-of-town friends here for a real slice of Arkansas life.

data.title: Convenient lunch spot near the State House
data.text: We stopped here for lunch prior to visiting e Capitol Building. A real political atmosphere, decorated with old campaign posters and signs. Warm, friendly service and great food at a reasonable price.

data.title: Fried Foods - Yuk.
data.text: For me, this place is only average, since there aren't a lot of healthy menu options.  Although a lot of people go to Cotham's, and it's usually very busy at lunch.  That being said, the service is reasonable and the staff are friendly.  I've only been a couple of times and probably won't be back unless they start offering a wider variety of healthy menu options.  So for me, I have to rate this as only average.
